summary: The document outlines the escalation process within a committee at Deutsche Bank, detailing the roles of the Chairperson and Secretary, as well as the procedures for tracking open issues and managing disagreements among committee members. It emphasizes the importance of communication and accountability in decision-making processes.
keyFacts: The document describes an escalation process for unresolved issues within a committee.
The Chairperson is responsible for representing the Risk Function and organizing procedures.
The Secretary tracks open issues and distributes updates to committee members.
Unit sponsors can escalate disagreements to the Unit ExCo.
The document is marked as confidential and for internal use only.
